gurmukhi: ncy mws hwrM ] hsY ibEm cwrM ] puAY eIs sIsM ] ClI bwrxIsM ]287]
transliteration: Nache Maas Haaran|| Hasai Biom Chaaran|| Puai Ees Seesan|| Chhalibaarneesan||287||
translation: The flesh-eating beings are dancing and vultures and crows in the sky are getting pleased; the rosaries of skulls are being strung for the neck of Shiva and it seems that all have got intoxicated on drinking wine.287.

gurmukhi: sutY SsqR DwrM ] ktY AsqR JwrY ] igry r`q KyqM ] kty bIr cyqM ]288]
transliteration: Soutai Shastra Dhaaran|| Katai Astra Jhaaran|| Gire Ratt Khetan|| Kate Beer Chetan||288||
translation: The warriors being chopped by chopped by the edges of the weapons and the blows of the arms, spilling their blood are getting unconscious and falling down.288.

gurmukhi: auTY kRU`D DwrM ] mcY SsqR JwrM ] KhY K`g KUnI ] cVY caup dUnI ]289]
transliteration: Outhai Kruddh Dhaaran|| Machai Shastra Jhaaran|| Khahai Khagg Khoonee|| Chadai Chaoup Doonee||289||
translation: The warriors, flowing in the current of anger, are striking dreadfully their weapons and with the collision of the bloody daggers they are being excited doubly.289.

gurmukhi: ippMsRox dyvI ] hsY AMs ByvI ] Atw A`t hwsM ] su joqM pRkwsM ]290]
transliteration: Pipansron Devee|| Hasai Ans Bhevee|| Ataa Att Haasan|| Su Jotan Prakaasan||290||
translation: The goddess, thirsty of blood, is laughing and her laughter is pervading on all the four sides like the illumination of her light.290.

gurmukhi: Fuky FIT FwlM ] ncy muMf mwlM ] krY SsqR pwqM ] auTY AsqR GwqM ]291]
transliteration: Doukhe Dhith Dhaalan|| Nache Mounnd Maalan|| Darai Shastra Paatan|| Outhai Astra Ghaatan||291||
translation: The determined warriors are fighting taking up their shields and Shiva wearing his rosary of skulls is dancing; the blows of weapons and arms are being struck.291.

gurmukhi: rupy vIr DIrM ] qjY qwx qIrM ] JmY ib`ju bygM ] lsY eym qygM ]292]
transliteration: Roupe Veer Dhderan|| Tajai Taan Tderan|| Jhamai Bijj(u) Begadg|| Lasai Em Tegadg||292||
translation: The patient warriors are discharging arrows by repeatedly pulling their bows and the swords are being struck like the flash of lightning.292.

gurmukhi: Khy K`g KUnI ] cVy cOp dUnI ] krY ic`qR cwrM ] bkY mwr mwrM ]293]
transliteration: Khahe Khagg Khoonee|| Chade Chaoup Doonee|| Darai Chittra Chaaran|| Bakai Maar Maaran||293||
translation: The bloody daggers are colliding and with double excitement, the warriors are fighting; those elegant warriors are shouting “kill, kill”.293.

gurmukhi: Apo Awp dwbYN ] rxM bIr PwbYN ] GxM Gwie pylYN ] mhw vIr JylYN ]294]
transliteration: Apo Aap Daahain|| Ranan Beer Phaahain|| Ghanng Ghaaepelain|| Mahaa Veer Jhelain||294||
translation: Pressing one another, the warriors are looking magnificent and the great warriors are inflicting wounds on one another.294.

gurmukhi: mfy vIr su`DM ] krY m`l ju`DM ] Apo Awp bwhYN ] auBY jIq cwhYN ]295]
transliteration: Made Veer Sudhan|| Darai Mall Juddhan|| Apo Aap Baahain|| Oubhai Jit Chaahain||295||
translation: The warriors are engaged like wrestlers among themselves and striking their weapons they are desiring for their victory.295.

gurmukhi: rxM rMg r`qy ] cVy qyj q`qy ] Kuly K`g KUnI ] cVY caup dUnI ]296]
transliteration: Ranan Ran Ratte|| Chade Tej Tatte|| Khule Khagg Khoonee|| Chadai Chaoup Doonee||296||
translation: The warriors are imbued with war and with double excitement, they are striking their bloody dagger.296.

gurmukhi: nBM hUr pUrM ] Bey vIr cUrM ] bjy qUr qwlI ] ncy muMf mwlI ]297]
transliteration: Nabhan Hoor Pooran|| Bhae Veey Chooran|| Bade Toor Taalee|| Nache Mounnd Maalee||297||
translation: The heavenly damsels are moving the sky and the warriors, greatly tired, are falling down; the sound of clapping is being heard and Shiva is dancing.297.

gurmukhi: rxM hUh au`TY ] srM Dwr bu`TY ] gjY vIr gwjI ] qury quMd qwjI ]298]
transliteration: Ranan Hooh Eetthai|| Saran Dhaar Boutthai|| Gadai Veer Gadjee|| Ture Tound Taajee||297||
translation: The sound of lamentation is rising in the battlefield and alongwith it, there is also shower of arrows; the warriors are thundering and the horses are running from this side to that side.298.

gurmukhi: BieE Gor Awhv ibkrwrw ] nwcy BUq pRyq bYqwrw ] bYrk bwx ggn gXo CweI ] jwnuk rYn idnih huie AweI ]299]
transliteration: Bhaio Ghor Aahav Bikraaraa|| Naache Bhoot Prêt Baitaaraa|| Bairak Baan Gadan Gyo Chhaade|| Jaanouk Rain Dinab(i) Hue Aaee||299||
translation: In this way, a dreadful war was waged and the ghosts, fiends and Baitals began to dance; the lances and arrows spread in the sky, and it appeared that the night had fallen during the day.299.
